casebody.data:
STATE of North Carolina
v.
Robert Paul DELAIR No. 30P19 Supreme Court of North Carolina. June 11, 2019 C. Melissa Owen, Attorney at Law, Cheyenne N. Chambers, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, for Delair, Robert Paul Anne J. Brown, Special Deputy Attorney General, Roxann L. Vaneekhoven, District Attorney, for State of North Carolina.

ORDER

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 22nd of January 2019 by Defendant for Temporary Stay:

"Motion Dissolved by order of the Court in conference, this the 11th of June 2019."

Upon consideration of the petition filed by Defendant on the 22nd of January 2019 for Writ of Supersedeas of the judgment of the Court of Appeals, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals:

"Denied by order of the Court in conference, this the 11th of June 2019."

Upon consideration of the petition filed on the 22nd of January 2019 by Defendant in this matter for discretionary review of the decision of the North Carolina Court of Appeals pursuant to G.S. 7A-31, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals:

"Denied by order of the Court in conference, this the 11th of June 2019."

Davis, J. recused
